intro: Symphytum regium, commonly known as the royal comfrey, is a perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and tall spikes of violet-blue flowers. The plant belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is known for its thick, fleshy stems and roots. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. Symphytum regium is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for healing purposes.
